To the chief Musician upon Shushaneduth, Michtam of David, to teach; when he strove with Aramnaharaim and with Aramzobah, when Joab returned, and smote of Edom in the valley of salt twelve thousand. O God, thou hast cast us off, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been displeased; O turn thyself to us again.<RF>Michtam: or, A golden Psalm<Rf><RF>scattered: Heb. broken<Rf>
Thou hast made the earth to tremble; thou hast broken it: heal the breaches thereof; for it shaketh.
Thou hast shewed thy people hard things: thou hast made us to drink the wine of astonishment.
Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee, that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.
That thy beloved may be delivered; save <FI>with<Fi> thy right hand, and hear me.<CM>
God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.
Gilead <FI>is<Fi> mine, and Manasseh <FI>is<Fi> mine; Ephraim also <FI>is<Fi> the strength of mine head; Judah <FI>is<Fi> my lawgiver;
Moab <FI>is<Fi> my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe: Philistia, triumph thou because of me.<RF>triumph…: or, triumph thou over me: (by an irony)<Rf>
Who will bring me <FI>into<Fi> the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?<RF>strong…: Heb. city of strength?<Rf>
<FI>Wilt<Fi> not thou, O God, <FI>which<Fi> hadst cast us off? and <FI>thou<Fi>, O God, <FI>which<Fi> didst not go out with our armies?
Give us help from trouble: for vain <FI>is<Fi> the help of man.<RF>help of man: Heb. salvation, etc<Rf>
Through God we shall do valiantly: for he <FI>it is that<Fi> shall tread down our enemies.<CM>
